page.title: 07Scotton/Northorpe:Farming-1
page.content: (1) Farms and Farm Workers The two villages are very similar in area (approx 2300 acres); 2/3rds of Scotton is farmland and there are 7 working farms in the village; in Northorpe an even higher proportion of the land is farmed by 6 farmers. Changes in farming practice, higher labour costs and larger machinery mean that relatively few people now work on the land (probably less than 20 Scotton men are now employed full time in farming or in work associated with agriculture; one of the largest farms used to employ 21 people). Farming remains an integral part of the vill- age scene, with tractors, trailers and combine harvesters familiar sights on the roads and in the fields: this does not prevent the occasional complaint about the noise of corn dryers, mud on the road or smoke from straw burning!
